attributes.additional_details: In light of the ongoing challenges posed by knife crime, it is imperative to consider the reintroduction of random stop and search procedures targeting individuals who conceal their identities with face coverings. This proactive approach aims to enhance public safety and deter criminal activity. By implementing these measures, law enforcement can more effectively identify and apprehend individuals who may pose a threat to community safety, ultimately fostering a safer environment for all citizens.
attributes.background: "Reintroduce Random Stop and Search specifically for those who use face coverings to conceal their identity

rejection.details:
Your petition is about something that the Scottish Government is responsible for. That means that the UK Government and Parliament can't look into it.  
 
The Scottish Parliament has its own Public Petitions Committee. If you'd like to send your petition to the Scottish Parliament, you can find out more here:  

https://www.parliament.scot/chamber-and-committees/committees/current-and-previous-committees/session-6-citizen-participation-and-public-petitions-committee
